general_requirements.statewide_program_name: Building and electrical permits required. Portland has Solar Prescriptive Path for simple roofs. Oregon requires registered design professional for certain systems.

interconnection.net_metering_details: Net metering available for systems up to 25 kW residential. PGE and Pacific Power primary utilities.

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: ORS 105.880 protects solar access. HOAs cannot prohibit solar.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Portland historic districts require additional review and may extend timeline several weeks.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Coastal areas have enhanced wind requirements. Design wind speeds 85-110 mph.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Mountain areas may have significant snow loads. Cascades 50-200+ psf.

licensing.license_type: Oregon Construction Contractors Board license. Electrical permits through Oregon BCD.

notes: Strong solar market with good incentives. Portland has streamlined Solar Prescriptive Path. NEC 2020 rapid shutdown requirements enforced. Clackamas County requires structural engineering for older homes.
